content:
• Thursday, November 29, 2018
  • TIK

    AMBA, WDAY, GME and VSLR among after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: TIK +16.7%. AMBA +11.7%. WDAY +9.4%. SPN +4.1%.
    • Top Losers: ASYS -16.9%. OTCPK:PSMMF -14.6%. GME -11.8%. VSLR -10.7%. YEXT -10.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • SFM

    Sprouts -3.8% as CEO plans December exit

    • Sprouts Farmers Market (NASDAQ:SFM) is down 3.8% after hours following news that CEO Amin Maredia is exiting his post on Dec. 30 to pursue other interests.
    • Jim Nielsen, currently president and chief operating officer, and Brad Lukow, currently chief financial officer, will serve as interim co-CEOs until the company locates a permanent successor.
    • Sprouts will engage an executive search firm, and Maredia will stay in an advisory role to assist with the transition.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM | 16 Comments
  • PAGS

    PagSeguro Digital sinks 8% AH after Q4 net margin narrows

    • PagSeguro Digital (NYSE:PAGS) sinks 8% in after-hours trading after reporting fiscal Q4 net income as a percentage of total revenue and income fell 1.1 percentage points to 20.4% from 21.5% a year ago.
    • Q4 total revenue and income increased to R$1.14B, up 66% from $R686.6M from a year ago; on a non-GAAP basis, total revenue and income rose 64% to R$1.12B; non-GAAP excludes a foreign exchange gain of R$14.3M from follow-on offering proceeds.
    • Q4 net income of R$231.6M vs. R$147.4M a year ago; non-GAAP net income for the most recent quarter is R$290.4M.
    • Q4 EPS of R$0.74 compares with R$0.56 a year ago; Q4 2018 non-GAAP EPS comes in at R$0.94.
    • Previously: PagSeguro reports Q3 results (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM | 14 Comments
  • AMBA

    Ambarella +11.7% on Q3 beats, downside revenue guide.

    • Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA) pops 11.7% aftermarket on Q3 beats despite the 36% Y/Y revenue decline. Downside Q4 guidance has revenue at $51M plus or minus 3% or about $49.5M to $52.5M (consensus: $55.6M).
    • Key management quote: ""The short term revenue outlook continues to be under pressure as our business shifts away from consumer electronic applications and faces geopolitical and macroeconomic challenges, as we have previously discussed. We are, however, very encouraged with our strategy and position at the forefront of the nascent computer vision market."
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Ambarella beats by $0.12, beats on revenue (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 18 Comments
  • PANW

    Palo Alto +2% on Q1 beats, upside guidance

    • Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) shares are up 2% on Q1 beats with EPS at $1.17 and revenue up 31% Y/Y to $656M. Upside Q2 guidance has revenue from $675M to $685M (consensus: $668.88M) and EPS of $1.20 to $1.22 (consensus: $1.20).
    • Revenue breakdown: Product, $240.5M (consensus: $220.9M); Services, $415.5M (consensus: $410.7M).
    • Billings were $758.5M (consensus: $755.8M; +27% Y/Y).
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Palo Alto Networks beats by $0.12, beats on revenue (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 6 Comments
  • HPQ

    HP gains on Q4 top-line beat, Consumer Hardware strength

    • HP (NYSE:HPQ) gains 1.3% after it reports Q4 results that beat top-line estimates with revenue up 11% Y/Y but came in-line on EPS.
    • Personal Systems Group stayed above revenue estimates across the units with total revenue at $10.06B compared to the $9.78B consensus.
    • Printing fell short with Supplies bringing in $3.39B (consensus: $3.41B) and Commercial Hardware at $1.25B (consensus: $1.3B). But Consumer Hardware outperformed with $667M compared to the $646.5M estimate.
    • In-line guidance has Q1 EPS from $0.50 to $0.53 (consensus: $0.52) and FY EPS from $2.12 to $2.22 (consensus: $2.19).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: HP EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 10 Comments
  • ABR

    Arbor Realty reports capital raise to buy back some shares from CEO

    • Arbor Realty Trust (NYSE:ABR) sinks 2.8% in after-hours trading after announcing plans for public offering of 8.7M shares of common stock.
    • Greenshoe for additional 1.3M shares.
    • Plans to use some of the proceeds to buy back company common stock from its CEO, Arbor Commercial Mortgage, and an estate planning family vehicle established by its CEO.
    • Also plans to use proceeds to make investments relating to its business and for general corporate purposes.
    • Previously: Arbor Realty +3% after Q3 beat, dividend boost (Nov. 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 19 Comments
  • VSLR

    Vivint Solar announces 8M-share secondary offering

    • Vivint Solar (NYSE:VSLR) -5.3% after-hours following news that its principal stockholder plans to offer and sell 8M common shares in an underwritten public offering, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 1.2M shares.
    • VSLR will not receive any proceeds from the sale of shares by the selling stockholder.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • SPLK

    Splunk reports Q3 beats, raises FY19 and 20 guidance

    • Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK) advances 1.3% after Q3 results that beat EPS estimates with a reported $0.38 and revenue estimates with $480.98M (+40% Y/Y). Upside Q4 guidance has revenue of around $560M (consensus: $556.73M).
    • Raised FY19 guidance has revenue of $1.74B (was: $1.685B) with operating margin of 11.5% to 12% (was: 11.5%). Raised FY20 guidance has revenue at $2.15B (was: $2B).
    • Revenue breakdown: License, $279.6M (consensus: $229.6M); Services, $201.4M (consensus: $202.4M).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Splunk beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 9 Comments
  • PVH

    PVH gains after profit beat

    • PVH (NYSE:PVH) trades higher after Q3 EPS tops estimates and full-year guidance is lifted. A 13% jump in international Tommy Hilfiger comparable sales highlighted the quarter.
    • CEO update: "We continue to over-deliver against our 2018 plan and are raising our full year earnings outlook based on our third quarter outperformance and our confidence in the opportunities for the fourth quarter, despite recent retailer bankruptcies in the U.S. and U.K. and increasing geopolitical volatility around the world."
    • The retailer now expects Q4 EPS of $1.58 to $1.60 vs. $1.58 consensus and full-year EPS of $9.33 to $9.35 vs. $9.20 to $9.25 prior.
    • PVH +2.1% AH.
    • Previously: Phillips-Van Heusen beats by $0.07, misses on revenue (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 6 Comments
  • ZUO

    Zuora reports Q3 results

    • Zuora (NYSE:ZUO): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of -$0.10; GAAP EPS of -$0.17.
    • Revenue of $61.64M (+33.0% Y/Y)
    • Shares +2.14%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 32 Comments
  • WDAY

    Workday +8% on earnings beat and raise

    • Workday (NYSE:WDAY) shares are up 8.3% after Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 34% Y/Y revenue growth. The company raises its FY19 subscription revenue guidance to between $2.375B and $2.377B (prior: $2.341B to $2.348B).
    • Q3 subscription revenue came in at $624.4M (+35% Y/Y; consensus: $610.8M) and subscription billings totaled $5.9B (+31%).  Services revenue was $118.8M (consensus: $111.9M).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Workday beats by $0.17, beats on revenue (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • HPQ

    HP EPS in-line, beats on revenue

    • HP (NYSE:HPQ): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.54 in-line; GAAP EPS of $0.91 beats by $0.41.
    • Revenue of $15.4B (+10.8% Y/Y) beats by $300M.
    • Shares +1.2%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 10 Comments
  • SPLK

    Splunk beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.07; GAAP EPS of -$0.38 misses by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $480.98M (+40.4% Y/Y) beats by $47.56M.
    • Shares +4.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 9 Comments
  • WDAY

    Workday beats by $0.17, beats on revenue

    • Workday (NYSE:WDAY): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.17; GAAP EPS of -$0.70 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $743.2M (+33.8% Y/Y) beats by $20.14M.
    • Shares +5%.

    | 4:02 PM | 9 Comments
  • AI

    Mortgage REITs log in a good day

    • With many financial sectors down or mixed today, mortgage REITs are clearly running well.
    • UBS ETRACS Monthly Pay 2x Leveraged Mortgage REIT ETN (NYSEARCA:MORL) +2.1% in late trading, and VanEck Mortgage REIT Income ETF (NYSEARCA:MORT) +0.6%.
    • That compares with the Financial Select Sector SPDR (XLF -0.9%), made up of big banks and other financial firms.
    • Arlington Asset Investment (AI +1.2%), Ellington Financial (EFC +1.5%), Armour Residential (ARR +1.1%), Two Harbors Investment (TWO +1%), and Invesco Mortgage Capital (IVR +1.2%) are among the leaders in the mortgage REIT sector.
    • Still, mortgage REITs are regaining some ground lost in September into October. For example, MORT's three-month return is -3.1%; YTD it's up 1.1%.
    • ETFs: MORL, REM, MORT
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 13 Comments
  • HEMP

    Farm Bill advancing through Congress; legal hemp cultivation looming; shares up 29%

    • Nano cap Hemp (OTCPK:HEMP +28.5%) is up on triple normal volume in apparent reaction to its announcement that the U.S. 2018 Farm Bill is nearing the finish line, including a provision legalizing hemp cultivation, production and distribution.
    • The company says when the bill passes, it will allow states to regulate hemp in addition to allowing hemp researchers to apply for grants from the Agriculture Department and enable hemp farmers to qualify for crop insurance.
    • Selected tickers: CGC, OTCPK:MJNA, ACB, OTCQB:PHOT, OTCPK:CBIS, APHQF, OTCQX:TRTC, CRON, OTCQX:CANN, OTCPK:ERBB, OTCPK:GRNH, OTCQB:PMCB, OTCQB:CVSI, OTC:FITX, MJ, OTCQB:CBDS, OTCPK:BLOZF, OTCQB:KSHB, OTCQB:MSRT, OTCQX:SPRWF, TLRY, OTCPK:AGTK, OTCPK:AMMJ, OTCPK:VAPE, HYYDF, OTCQB:GBLX, OTCQB:AERO, OTCQB:MCOA, OTC:HMLSF, OTCQB:CNAB, OTC:FSPM, OTCPK:EAPH, OTCQB:SRNA, OTCQB:RMHB, OTCPK:PLPL, OTCQX:MNTR, OTCPK:EDXC, OTCQX:THCBF, OTC:FSPM, OTCPK:EAPH, OTCQB:SRNA, OTCQB:RMHB, OTCPK:PLPL, OTCQX:MNTR, OTCPK:EDXC, OTCQX:THCBF, OTCQB:KAYS, OTCQB:ENRT, OTCPK:ENDO, OTCQB:NTRR, OTCPK:REFG
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 158 Comments
  • PIXY

    ShiftPixy -34% in earnings selloff

    • ShiftPixy (PIXY -33.7%) crumbles after Q3 results disappoint to send shares below $3 for the first time since August.
    • Trading volume on PIXY is 8X normal activity.
    • Previously: ShiftPixy reports FY results (Nov. 28)
    • Previously: More on ShiftPixy Q4 results (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM

  • U.S. stocks swing to gains after Fed minutes take `flexible' tone

    • U.S. stock markets turn positive after the Fed's November meeting minutes disclosed a couple FOMC members felt the fed funds rate might be near "neutral"--a point at which it doesn't speed up or slow down economic growth.
    • Furthermore, the next meeting's statement may focus less on its path of "further gradual increases" and more on monitoring economic data to guide policy.
    • In late afternoon trading, the S&P 500 rises 0.3%, the Dow +0.4%, and the Nasdaq advances 0.4%.
    • Stocks started the turnaround, though, after a report that the U.S. and China are exploring the potential to suspend further tariffs in the spring and start new talks that would look at big changes in Chinese economic policy.
    • By sector, basic materials +0.9%, healthcare +0.8%, and industrial goods +0.5% lead the advance.
    • Conglomerates -0.6% and financial -0.1% lag.
    • Crude oil rises 2.3% to $51.46.
    • U.S. dollar index -0.04%.
    • U.S. 2-year Treasury note price rises, with yield down 1 basis point to 2.803%; 10-year Treasury also rises, pushing yield down 2 bps to 3.035%.
    • Previously: `Almost all' FOMC members see another hike `fairly soon': Fed minutes (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • MRIN

    Technology movers and shakers

    • Gainers: Marin Software (NASDAQ:MRIN) +22%. iCAD (NASDAQ:ICAD) +13%. RF Industries (NASDAQ:RFIL) +12%. Innodata (NASDAQ:INOD) +10%. NII Holdings (NASDAQ:NIHD) +9%.
    • Losers: Bitauto Holdings (NYSE:BITA) -11%. Intelsat S.A. (NYSE:I) -10%. Bilibili (NASDAQ:BILI) -9%. Uxin Limited (NASDAQ:UXIN) -9%. Aethlon Medical (NASDAQ:AEMD) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • PCG

    California regulator to weigh PG&E restructuring following deadly fire

    • PG&E (PCG -2.6%) turns lower as California Public Utilities Commission chief Michael Picker indicates he plans to examine the utility's corporate structure and governance with an eye toward determining whether a breakup is needed.
    • Picker's comments come as the PUC voted to order PG&E to adopt recommendations designed to improve its safety practices in response to the 2010 San Bruno explosion that killed eight people.
    • After losing more than half their value, PG&E shares have been stabilizing on speculation that state lawmakers will introduce legislation to ease the company’s liabilities from this year’s fires.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 18 Comments
  • FIZZ

    National Beverage -4% after more Guggenheim gloom

    • National Beverage (NASDAQ:FIZZ) is down 4.44% after Guggenheim doubles down on its Sell rating on the beverage stock.
    • The firm sees the La Croix marketing flap standing as an earnings headwind in the short term.
    • Analyst Laurent Grandet and team trim the price target on FIZZ to $83 ahead of next week's earnings report. The 52-week low for shares is $81.11.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 15 Comments
  • CAKE

    Cheesecake Factory -4% as analysts pile on

    • Barclays trims estimates on Underweight-rated Cheesecake Factory (CAKE -4.4%) after factoring in the impact of the higher minimum wages in California over the next several years. The firm cuts its price target on CAKE to $44 from $47.
    • Earlier this week, Wedbush warned on soft traffic trends for Cheesecake Factory over the Thanksgiving holiday weekend. Also in the mix, several other firms have pointed that Cheesecake Factory's Q4 comparable sales are likely to be impacted by the wildfires in California where the chain has a high concentration of restaurants.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 4 Comments
  • ZKIN

    ZK International and Sanchez Midstream Partners among Energy/Materials gainers; Ferrellgas Partners and Bristow among losers

    • Gainers: ZK International (NASDAQ:ZKIN) +18%. Sanchez Midstream Partners (NYSEMKT:SNMP) +9%. Baytex Energy (NYSE:BTE) +8%. Basic Energy Services (NYSE:BAS) +8%. Superior Drilling Products (NYSEMKT:SDPI) +8%.
    • Losers: Ferrellgas Partners (NYSE:FGP) -10%. Bristow Group (NYSE:BRS) -8%. Precision Drilling (NYSE:PDS) -7%. Alcoa (NYSE:AA) -7%. Hecla Mining (NYSE:HL) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • EDIT

    More details emerge from controversial gene-editing experiment in China

    • In a presentation at the 2nd International Summit on Human Genome Editing in Hong Kong, Chinese researcher He Jiankui said he was "proud" of his achievement and disclosed that a second pregnancy may be on the way.
    • Eight couples undergoing fertility treatments initially enrolled in the trial, but one dropped out. 30 embryos from the remaining seven couples were created and 21 (70%) were edited using CRISPR/Cas9 to knock out the HIV-related gene CCR5.
    • Cord blood from the twin girls, born about a month ago, showed no off-target effects from the gene editing. Both will be followed for 18 years to check for off-target mutations, resistance to HIV and any other potential side effects.
    • He admitted that disabling the CCR5 gene, which is involved immunity, could make the girls more susceptible to infectious diseases but the parents were still in favor of the procedure after being informed of the risks. The father is HIV-positive.
    • Related tickers: (EDIT +2.6%)(CRSP +3.7%)(NTLA +4.1%)
    • Previously: CRISPR Therapeutics up 4% premarket reported use of CRISPR/Cas9 in humans (Nov. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM | 21 Comments
  • JACK

    Jack in the Box +5% on Reuters report of possible sale

    • Jack in the Box (NASDAQ:JACK) has jumped 5.3% to session highs on a Reuters report that the company is examining options included a potential sale.
    • The company started talks with potential suitors this month, including private-equity firms, according to the reports.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 2 Comments
  • RIG

    Transocean shareholders OK Ocean Rig acquisition

    • Transocean (RIG +2.6%) says its shareholders overwhelmingly approved the acquisition of Ocean Rig UDW (ORIG +1.5%) and expects to close the deal "in the coming days."
    • RIG offered 1.6128 newly issued shares plus $12.75 in cash for each ORIG common share, for a total implied value of $32.28/share; RIG and ORIG shareholders will own ~79% and 21%, respectively, of the combined company.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • GSHD

    Goosehead Insurance leads financial gainers; Commerce Bancshares and Fanhua among losers

    • Gainers: Goosehead Insurance (NASDAQ:GSHD) +6%. Loop Industries (NASDAQ:LOOP) +6%.
    • Losers: PPDAI Group (NYSE:PPDF) -10%. Commerce Bancshares (NASDAQ:CBSH) -6%. Fanhua (NASDAQ:FANH) -6%. WisdomTree Investments (NASDAQ:WETF) -5%. Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft (NYSE:DB) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • NSPR

    InspireMD up 2% on long-term CGuard data

    • Nano cap InspireMD (NSPR +1.5%) is up on below-average volume in response to updated data on its CGuard Embolic Prevention System (EPS). The results were presented at the VEITHsymposium in New York.
    • Results from a study in Poland involving 251 patients with high-risk stenosis (narrowing) in the carotid arteries (arteries located on each side of the neck that transport blood the head, brain and face) showed a treatment benefit and favorable safety profile at 36 months of follow-up.
    • Six-month follow-up data on 70 patients in Germany showed a 100% technical success rate with no peri- or post-interventional strokes observed and no intra-stent restenosis (artery narrows again after the procedure).
    • The company says CGuard EPS is designed to prevent embolization by trapping potential emboli (e.g., blood clot, air bubble, fatty deposit) against the arterial wall by virtue of its MicroNet technology.
    • Previously: InspireMD's CGuard EPS shows sustained benefit in extension study; shares ahead 8% premarket (May 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • ADIL

    Healthcare and Services tops midday movers

    • Gainers: Adial Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADIL) +137%. Tonix Pharmaceuticals Holding (NASDAQ:TNXP) +93%. Titan Machinery (NASDAQ:TITN) +26%. Kirkland's (NASDAQ:KIRK) +24%. Realm Therapeutics (RLM) +24%. Genesis Healthcare (NYSE:GEN) +22%. Tech Data (NASDAQ:TECD) +20%. Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF) +18%. Arsanis (NASDAQ:ASNS) +18%. ZK International Group (NASDAQ:ZKIN) +16%.

China Jo-Jo Drugstores (NASDAQ:CJJD) -13%. YETI Holdings (NYSE:YETI) -11%. Bitauto Holdings (NYSE:BITA) -12%. RYB Education (NYSE:RYB) -11%. Hebron Technology (NASDAQ:HEBT) -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM

  • Tech lunch: Sector sees red

    • The tech sector (NYSEARCA:XLK) -1% is seeing red today with the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index down 0.4% compared to the 0.2% drop for the S&P 500 and 0.3% drop for Nasdaq.
    • Gainers include Qualcomm +3.5% after CEO and ex-chair comments on the company's future, Nielsen +4.2% on the entry of a new bidder for the company, and Tech Data +19.8% after earnings.
    • Micron -1.8% is among the shares feeling pressure after cutting its top-line guidance yesterday though profit beat estimates. Twitter -5.7% slumps on a report that Fox News and related parties plan to boycott the platform.
    • Related broad tech ETFs: XLK, VGT, TECL, FTEC, IYW, ROM, QTEC, RYT, FNG, TECS, IGM, FXL, XNTK, REW, JHMT, XITK.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • STZ

    Macquarie cools on Constellation Brands

    • Macquarie lowers Constellation Brands (STZ -2.2%) to a Neutral rating from Outperform on concerns that the company's investment in Canopy Growth won't live up to expectations.
    • The investment firm lowers its price target on STZ to $210 from $245 as it sees a costly path to building cannabis brands over the next few years.
    • Shares of Constellation Brands have ranged from $187.87 to $236.62 over the last 52 weeks.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 12 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing named Cowen's top aerospace stock for 2019; shares +1.5%

    • Boeing (BA +1.5%) moves higher after Cowen's Cai von Rumohr names it his no. 1 aerospace stock pick for 2019, reiterating an Outperform rating and $445 price target and saying the company "is in a production sweet spot" heading into next year.
    • "Most investors miss the power of BA's favorable production environment and potential to deliver extended cash flow ramp," von Rumohr says, adding "concern over recent headline risks (Lion Air crash, Saudi arms sale restrictions, etc.) also looks overblown."
    • The analyst sees pricing remaining stable while BA shifts to more profitable models and faces no upcoming labor negotiations, which leads him to forecast cash flow per share reaching $28.60 in 2019, easily ahead of Wall Street estimates, and as high as $35 in 2021, which would allow dividend hikes to ~$10/share.
    • BA bears are wrong, von Rumohr says, in overlooking the power of a favorable product environment and the more than seven-year backlog during a period of growing airline traffic.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 5 Comments
  • TOCA

    Tocagen teams up with NRG Oncology in study of Toca 511 & Toca FC in brain cancer

    • Thinly traded micro cap Tocagen (TOCA +1.9%) perks up on below-average volume on the heels of its announced collaboration with NRG Oncology on a Phase 2/3 clinical trial evaluating Toca 511 (vocimagene amiretrorepvec) & Toca FC (flucytosine, extended-release) in patients with newly diagnosed glioblastoma, an aggressive cancer that occurs in the brain or spinal cord.
    • NRG Oncology, a member of the National Clinical Trial Network, will conduct the study, funded primarily by a National Cancer Institute grant, while Tocagen will provide product and additional financial support. The trial should launch in 2019.
    • Toca 511 & Toca FC is a two-part cancer immunotherapy. Toca 511 is a retroviral-replicating vector that selectively infects cancer cells and delivers a gene that encodes for an enzyme called cytosine deaminase (CD). Toca FC, an orally administered prodrug of the chemo agent 5-FU that crosses the blood-brain barrier, converts to 5-FU when it encounters CD.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • ARNC

    Arconic +3% as Reuters reports Elliott stepping in to boost sale process

    • Arconic (ARNC +3%) shares pop following a Reuters report that activist shareholder Elliott Management has stepped in to assume potential liabilities that are holding up the company's pending sale process.
    • Elliott has offered to take on ARNC’s cladding business and also roll its 11% stake into the winning bid for the company, which would allow the hedge fund to retain its equity in the company while other shareholders get cash, according to the report.
    • ARNC's board reportedly has asked Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO), as well as a buyout consortium led by Blackstone (NYSE:BX) and Carlyle (NASDAQ:CG) to submit new offers for the company on Friday, and plans to meet next week to review the offers.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM | 41 Comments
  • LFVN

    LifeVantage leads consumer gainers and YETI Holdings leads losers

    • Gainers: LifeVantage (NASDAQ:LFVN) +11%. Orchids Paper Products (NYSEMKT:TIS) +10%. Planet Green Holdings (NYSEMKT:PLAG) +8%. La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB) +7%. New Age Beverages (NASDAQ:NBEV) +6%.
    • Losers: YETI Holdings (NYSE:YETI) -8%. Pyxus International (NYSE:PYX) -7%. Libbey (NYSEMKT:LBY) -6%. Youngevity International (NASDAQ:YGYI) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • DXCM

    FDA issues new draft guidance for blood glucose monitors

    • Aimed at modernizing the criteria for 501(k) submissions to account for new technologies for prescription and over-the-counter glucose test systems, the FDA has issued updated draft guidance for manufacturers that it says should improve the safety, accuracy and reliability of blood glucose monitoring across the range of settings of use (e.g., at home, critical care).
    • Related tickers: (DXCM +3.7%)(PODD +1.4%)(TNDM +0.3%)(OTCQX:RHHBY -0.6%)(MDT +1.5%)(ABT +0.9%)(DRIO -1.1%)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 4 Comments
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm +3.5% on exec comments about Apple, going private

  • NHYDY

    Norsk Hydro forecasts weaker aluminum demand growth in 2019

    • Norsk Hydro (OTCQX:NHYDY -3.8%) says it expects global primary aluminum demand growth to slow next year and that it has been "heavily" affected by slowing production at its Alunore alumina refinery, the world's largest.
    • Hydro sees aluminum demand growth slowing to 2%-3% next year from an expected 4% in 2018, as trade sanctions and tariffs impact global flows of aluminum.
    • CEO Svein Richard Brandtzaeg says Hydro still has no firm timeline for the restart of full production at Alunorte, which has been operating at half capacity since February following a spill of untreated water, but is continuing to work with Brazilian authorities to lift restrictions.
    • Alunorte is the world’s largest alumina refinery, with a capacity of ~6.3M metric tons/year of alumina.
    • Hydro also repeats it will not catch up with its program to raise operating profit by NOK3B in the 2016-19 period, with planned improvements currently leaving it lagging by NOK500M.
    • ETFs: FOIL, JJUB
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM

  • I

    Analysts stick up for C-band as Intelsat drops amid offering

    • Intelsat (NYSE:I) is 10.1% lower, building on yesterday's postmarket declines from a 10M-share offering that will let BC Partners and Silver Lake cut stakes.
    • While it's tempting to read into that a take on prospects for Intelsat's high-stakes bet on mid-band spectrum monetization, RBC Capital expects it's more about private-equity portfolio management as the year's end draws near.
    • Operators are still in an enviable position to monetize the "Goldilocks" band -- sitting at the just-right spot among the three main 5G bands -- and a crystallizing event in C-band should come in early to mid-2019, analyst Wilton Fry says. He has an Outperform rating on Intelsat with a price target of $66, implying 149% upside. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • It's hard to blame BC and Silver Lake for taking profit after the year Intelsat's had, "but the obvious question is 'why now'?" asks Barclays. Like RBC, the firm doesn't see new issues around C-band.
